body_html:
You can call queue size operation directly from graph, ie

print(tf.get_default_graph().as_graph_def())
...
node {
name: "batch/fifo_queue_Size"
op: "QueueSize"
input: "batch/fifo_queue"
...
then you can do sess.run("batch/fifo_queue_Size") to get number of elements in that queue

then you can do sess.run("batch/fifo_queue_Size") to get number of elements in that queue
body:
You can call queue size operation directly from graph, ie

print(tf.get_default_graph().as_graph_def())
...
node {
  name: "batch/fifo_queue_Size"
  op: "QueueSize"
  input: "batch/fifo_queue"
...
then you can do `sess.run("batch/fifo_queue_Size")` to get number of elements in that queue
